objects.name: Analytic 0760
objects.description: Processes like curl, wget, python, socat, or custom binaries initiating TLS/SSL sessions to non-standard destinations. Defender sees abnormal syscalls for connect(), loading of libssl libraries, and persistent outbound encrypted traffic from daemons not normally communicating externally.

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: auditd:SYSCALL
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: socket/connect with TLS context by unexpected process

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: linux:syslog
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: system daemons initiating TLS sessions outside expected services

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: linux:osquery
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Processes linked with libssl or crypto libraries making outbound connections

x_mitre_mutable_elements.description: Legitimate system services expected to use TLS (e.g., package updates).
Trusted CAs; flag self-signed or unrecognized certs.
